condition.description:
If you suffer from migraine headaches, you're not alone. About 12 percent of the U.S. population gets them. Migraines are recurring attacks of moderate to severe pain. The pain is throbbing or pulsing, and is often on one side of the head. During migraines, people are very sensitive to light and sound. They may also become nauseated and vomit.

Migraine is three times more common in women than in men. Some people can tell when they are about to have a migraine because they see flashing lights or zigzag lines or they temporarily lose their vision.

Many things can trigger a migraine. These include

  • Anxiety
  • Stress
  • Lack of food or sleep
  • Exposure to light
  • Hormonal changes (in women)

Doctors used to believe migraines were linked to the opening and narrowing of blood vessels in the head. Now they believe the cause is related to genes that control the activity of some brain cells. Medicines can help prevent migraine attacks or help relieve symptoms of attacks when they happen. For many people, treatments to relieve stress can also help.

NIH: National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke
condition.name: Migraine
symptoms: Throbbing or pulsing headache, usually on one side of the head
Aura: Flashing lights or zigzagging lines in your vision

carousel_items: Using low doses (81mg) of aspirin every day can lower your risk of heart attack and stroke, but it isn't good for everyone. Only take aspirin daily if your doctor recommends it.
Higher aspirin doses can be used to treat occasional pain, swelling, and fever. Using ibuprofen or acetaminophen (Tylenol) instead can lower your risk of serious bleeding.
Take with food to lower the chance of an upset stomach.
Don't use for kids younger than 18 years old.

basics.benefits_moa: Aspirin is a salicylate and non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It blocks the inflammation process in your body, which relieves swelling and pain. It also prevents blood platelets from forming clots, which thins your blood.
basics.bottom_line: A low dose of Aspirin (81mg) every day can protect your heart, but it's not the best medicine to take for pain, swelling, or fever.
downsides: Not a preferred medication for treating pain, swelling, or fever due to its high risk of bleeding.
NSAIDs (like ibuprofen and naproxen) and acetaminophen (Tylenol) are better for treating pain and fever thank aspirin.
Aspirin raises your risk of bleeding, especially when used with other blood thinner medications like warfarin (Coumadin).
Studies show that using higher doses of Aspirin (162 mg or more) every day raises your risk of stomach bleeding and doesn't provide any additional heart protection.

NSAIDs (like ibuprofen and naproxen) and acetaminophen (Tylenol) are better for treating pain and fever thank aspirin.

Studies show that using higher doses of Aspirin (162 mg or more) every day raises your risk of stomach bleeding and doesn't provide any additional heart protection.

upsides: When taking low doses (81 mg) every day, aspirin provides protection for your heart and prevents heart attacks and stroke.

risks_warnings.title: Brain damage or death from Reye's Syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Aspirin use is linked to a condition called Reye's syndrome that causes liver and brain swelling. This is rare but very serious. Let your doctor know about any nausea, vomiting, unusually low energy, or changes in behavior.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Aspirin can cause serious problems including inflammation, bleeding, and ulcers in the stomach or intestines. The longer you take Aspirin, the higher the risk is. If you notice blood or a dark/black color in your stool, tell your doctor right away.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers
Taking aspirin, NSAIDs, or blood thinners
Drinking more than 3 alcoholic beverages a day

basics.benefits_moa: Ibuprofen is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It blocks the inflammation process in your body, which relieves swelling and pain.
basics.bottom_line: Ibuprofen works well for mild to moderate pain and inflammation, but it doesn't last as long as other NSAIDs.
downsides: Ibuprofen doesn't work as long as other NSAIDs, so follow the package directions on how often you can take it.
It needs to be taken with food to avoid getting an upset stomach.
Can't be taken by pregnant women.
It can cause serious kidney and stomach problems (like ulcers and bleeding) the longer you take it.
Like all NSAIDs, it can raise your risk of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke.

basics.benefits_moa: Lamictal is an antiepileptic. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it seems to calm nerve activity in the brain.
basics.bottom_line: Lamictal is most useful for treating severe seizure disorders, and for bipolar disorder with more depression symptoms than manic symptoms. Just be careful to increase your dose slowly to avoid skin rash.
downsides: Can cause double vision, dizziness, sleepiness, and headache.
Has the risk of a rare but life-threatening rash.
Can make hormonal birth control less effective.
Might be less effective than other medicines for treating manic episodes (acute mania) in people with bipolar disorder.

upsides: Effective at lowering the frequency of seizures in people with epilepsy or Lennox-Gestaut syndrome. Typically used together with other medications for severe seizure disorders.
Works best for partial, tonic-clonic, and absence seizures.
A first-line treatment for bipolar disorder. Effective long-term treatment for stabilizing mood. Prevents both depressive and manic episodes, but the effect is greater for preventing depression.
Doesn't require routine blood tests.

userStories.tip: At 200mg, I developed some really nasty forehead acne and my skin was extremely oily, even with cleaning 2x/day and retin-a. I finally saw a dermatologist who mentioned he's had patients suffer from lamictal-induced acne...not just a rash.

Weirdest/best side effect from any medicine goes to Lamictal - for the first couple weeks I had really intense and vivid movie-like dreams. It gives me horrible headaches but I take it before bed so I sleep through it.
It saved my life...but titrate slowly. Too high = what I call "woo woo's"; cerebral palsy-like symptoms (full body jerks, almost seizure like but fully aware & able to communicate).
Need to monitor for liver toxicity
Blurred vision, uncontrolled muscle jerks, shaking
Double Vision is really a hassle comes and goes. Tremors, have an unexpected jerk in my hand. Have knocked things over and off the stand, but helps control my anger.

The generic versions do not work. I found out the hard way - I was switched to the generic and ended up with a very bad depression. Things turned around once the insurance co approved the brand name. It is pricey.

userStories.identifier: Woman with PTSD and Bipolar II disorder
userStories.tip: Has changed my life in evening out my mood- no hypo mania but kind of miss feeling more motivated. Have trouble initiating and have to take a lot of countering supplements to deal with fuzzy brain. Worsening soluble vision is a problem.
Doctors don't tell you it causes double vision. Also can cause fuzzy thinking at higher doses- sometimes called "Lamictal Stupid."

stick with it for a little more time b4 you count it out /don't play with doses! it took at least 6mnths (after months of figuring out and getting up to right dose with my dr) for me to realize how much less severe & freqnt episodes were!
Take it slow. Don't expect overnight changes.
supresses libido at 75 mg

I feel great on lamotrigine. Other seizure drugs depressed me.
But... not all manufacturers' pills are the same. My pharmacist must give me pills from the same generic company. Glaxo-SK's Lamictal is one of the worst for me.
Splitting up dosages in the morning and evening helps with "smoothening" out the side effects such as dizziness. Definitely take the branded XR version. Generic Lamotrigine was horrible for me.

I was on Serezone for 10 years and stopped working. I augmented with Lamictal and it made a world of difference. I have a lot more energy and my outlook has changed.  As of 2 months ago, I am no longer on Serezone, just Lamictal. It is great
userStories.identifier: Active, in great shape, feel like 40

userStories.tip: Lamictal saved my life. However some of the side effects are annoying such as neck pain,problems with co-ordination, ( have had a few very bad falls) judging distances  ( parking is a nightmare) and some  minor.skin problems. Overall the side effects are worth it to me. My moods are very stable. Very rarely depressed or hypomanic. Life is good.
take it twice a day... the effects do not last for 24 hours and taking it twice a day evens out your experience.
Extended release version seems to have fewer side effects than immediate-release.  Best to take in a.m.

userStories.identifier: Someone who has struggled with dysthymia
userStories.tip: It took a little tinkering to find the dosage that worked best for me.

Must titer up and down slowly... comes in 50mg and 100mg intervals so you can gradually adjust the dosage until you get it right. I take between 200mg and 300mg. It's the only medication that has consistently controlled my mood swings.
this is the first medication that worked for both seizures and bipolar disorder. seriously a life saver.

I have a pretty atypical case of bipolar, but the lamictal really cuts down on the irritability. When I'm in the depths of my depression or super manic, I'm actually pleasant to be around and don't take everything super personally.

Worked wonders for mood stability, best ever.  Do not miss a dose or you will go through nasty withdrawal! Have immunoglobulin levels checked before starting & monitored, as it can cause an immune deficiency.
Double vision went away when I started taking Lamictal Xr instead of the regular type. Haven't experienced any other side effects.
It saved my life.
Really I don't fell any hassle, even when I left for some time, the only thing that happened is my mood didn't go very well.
Take it around the same time every day. I have to take mine in the morning and at night. Also taking it with food helps curb nausea & any possible drowsiness.
if you forget to take it for a day or two you'll be okay but youll begin to feel it, life saver

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Lamictal may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Lamictal may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Serious skin rash

risk_factors: Taking more than the prescribed dose

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Lamictal can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Lamictal can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Lamictal can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Lamictal can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away.

risks_warnings.title: Meningitis
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Lamictal can cause meningitis, a serious inflammation of the lining around the brain. This can occur from six weeks after starting the medication to whenever you stop taking it. If you have any sudden rash, fever, sensitivity to light, neck stiffness, headache, nausea, or vomiting, tell your doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Interactions with birth control pills
risks_warnings.description: Taking birth control pills may lower the amount of Lamictal in your body. Stopping birth control pills may suddenly increase the amount of Lamictal in your body. This can be dangerous. Talk to your doctor if you're taking birth control pills, or if you're thinking about starting or stopping them.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal seizures
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Lamictal suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Lamictal, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

carousel_items: Take Cambia at the smallest dose possible for the shortest amount of time to reduce your risk of heart attack.
Can cause swelling in the legs, an upset stomach, constipation, and abdominal pain.
Don't drink alcohol or smoke while on Cambia since that can increase the risk of stomach issues.

basics.benefits_moa: Cambia is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It blocks the inflammation process in your body, which relieves swelling and pain.
basics.bottom_line: Cambia is an okay medication used to treat pain and swelling. However, because of the risk of heart attack, it's recommended to limit the amount you take.
downsides: Has to be taken for the shortest amount of time possible to lower the risk of heart attack.
If you're taking it on a regular basis, you'll need to get labs done to make sure your liver and kidneys aren't being affected.
You should avoid smoking and using alcohol while on Cambia since they can increase your risk of stomach problems.
You can't take Cambia if you have phenylketonuria (PKU) since the packets contain aspartame (phenylalanine).

upsides: Can be used as needed to treat pain and swelling.
Recommended for treating arthritis pain and swelling if acetaminophen (Tylenol) isn't working.
Available as a generic, so it is cheap.

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take Cambia at the smallest dose possible for the shortest amount of time to reduce your risk of heart attack.
Can cause swelling in the legs, an upset stomach, constipation, and abdominal pain.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack or stroke
risks_warnings.description: Cambia can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Take the lowest dose for the shortest time possible to lower your risk. Never take Cambia during the first two weeks after having heart surgery.

description_processed.orig: Cambia can increase your chance of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke. Take the lowest dose for the shortest time possible to lower your risk. Never take Cambia during the first two weeks after having heart surgery.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Cambia can cause serious stomach problems that include inflammation, ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time.
risk_factors: History of stomach bleeding or ulcers

description_processed.orig: Cambia can cause serious stomach problems that include inflammation, ulcers, bleeding, and holes in the stomach or intestines. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time.

risks_warnings.title: Bruising or bleeding
risks_warnings.description: You can bruise more easily while using Cambia. If you're bleeding, it can take longer than normal for the bleeding to stop. Tell your doctor about all of your medical conditions and medications before starting Cambia. Don't take Cambia while using other blood thinning medications unless your doctor tells you it is safe.

description_processed.orig: You can bruise more easily while using Cambia. If you're bleeding, it can take longer than normal for the bleeding to stop. Tell your doctor about all of your medical conditions and medications before starting Cambia. Don't take Cambia while using other blood thinning medications unless your doctor tells you it is safe.

risks_warnings.title: Lowers kidney function
risks_warnings.description: Cambia, and similar medications in the NSAID family, can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time necessary can lower your risk of kidney problems. It's important to get lab tests to check your kidney function periodically if you use Cambia for long periods of time.
risk_factors: Taking ACE inhibitors or angiotensin receptor blockers (ARBs)

description_processed.orig: Cambia, and similar medications in the NSAID family, can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. Taking the lowest dose for the shortest amount of time necessary can lower your risk of kidney problems. It's important to get lab tests to check your kidney function periodically if you use Cambia for long periods of time.

risks_warnings.title: Increased blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Cambia can raise your blood pressure.  Most people usually don't feel any differently when their blood pressure is high, so check your blood pressure periodically to watch out for it. If you have high blood pressure and need a medication for the long-term treatment of pain, talk with your doctor since a different medication may be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to unborn babies
risks_warnings.description: If you're in the late stages of pregnancy (more than 30 weeks), taking Cambia can increase the risk of a heart defect in your baby. Talk with your doctor before using this medication while pregnant.

description_processed.orig: If you're in the late stages of pregnancy (more than 30 weeks), taking Cambia can increase the risk of a heart defect in your baby. Talk with your doctor before using this medication while pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: Reaction to aspartame (phenylalanine)
risks_warnings.description: Cambia packets contain aspartame (phenylalanine). People who have phenylketonuria (PKU) can't break down the amino acid phenylalanine. It builds up and causes serious medical problems. If you have PKU don't take Cambia packets. There are other dosage forms that may be better for you. Ask your doctor or pharmacist.

carousel_items: Take it as soon as your headache starts.
If you use the nasal spray, be sure to blow your nose before using it.
If you use the patch, put it on a dry area free of scars, tattoos, or other cuts and scrapes. Be sure to press the button to activate it.
If you use the injection, you can use a second injection if you still have a headache after an hour. If you have symptoms 2 hours after the injection, switch to the pill version.
Sumatriptan can make you drowsy, so avoid activities that need you to be fully alert until you know how it affects you.
Lie down in a dark room after taking Sumatriptan to help ease the pain.

basics.benefits_moa: Sumatriptan is a triptan medication that treats migraine headaches. It releases serotonin, which lowers the inflammation that causes headaches.
basics.bottom_line: Sumatriptan is an excellent choice for acute migraine relief, but you might need another medication to prevent headaches.
downsides: The oral and nasal versions of Sumatriptan have an unpleasant after-taste.
Does not prevent migraine headaches; it only treats them once they start.
Must wait 1 hour before using second injection.
Can cause rebound (more) headaches if Sumatriptan is used too often.
Need to have your blood pressure checked often, especially if you're pregnant.

downsides_processed.orig: The oral and nasal versions of Sumatriptan have an unpleasant after-taste.
Does not prevent migraine headaches; it only treats them once they start.
Must wait 1 hour before using second injection.
Can cause rebound (more) headaches if Sumatriptan is used too often.
Need to have your blood pressure checked often, especially if you're pregnant.

upsides: Comes in several forms. Ask your doctor if you should use the pill, nasal spray, patch, or injection.
A combination of forms can be used if symptoms do not improve.
The nasal spray and injectable forms work very quickly.
It's generally safe to use if you are pregnant.
Comes in a generic form, so it can be pretty cheap.

Lie down in a dark room after taking Sumatriptan to help ease the pain.

risks_warnings.title: Tightening of blood vessels (myocardial angina, ischemia, or infarction)
risks_warnings.description: Some people taking Sumatriptan have reported temporary chest pain, pressure, and tightness. These symptoms are caused by heart vessels being constricted/tightened. Before starting Sumatriptan, people who have coronary artery disease, or are more likely to have it, should talk to their doctor about having a heart health assessment.

description_processed.orig: Some people taking Sumatriptan have reported temporary chest pain, pressure, and tightness. These symptoms are caused by heart vessels being constricted/tightened. Before starting Sumatriptan, people who have coronary artery disease, or are more likely to have it, should talk to their doctor about having a heart health assessment.

risks_warnings.title: Stroke
risks_warnings.description: Taking Sumatriptan can also increase your chances of a stroke. If you have a history of cardiovascular disease (including previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat), talk to your doctor before starting Sumatriptan.

description_processed.orig: Taking Sumatriptan can also increase your chances of a stroke. If you have a history of cardiovascular disease (including previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat), talk to your doctor before starting Sumatriptan.

risks_warnings.title: Stomach bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Taking Sumatriptan can cause a constriction of the blood vessels in your digestive tract. If you have unusual stomach pain or bloody diarrhea while taking Sumatriptan, be sure to seek medical attention.

description_processed.orig: Taking Sumatriptan can cause a constriction of the blood vessels in your digestive tract. If you have unusual stomach pain or bloody diarrhea while taking Sumatriptan, be sure to seek medical attention.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Taking Sumatriptan along with medications used for your mood, such as monoamine oxidase inhibitors and certain antidepressants, can make you more likely to have a serious condition called serotonin syndrome. Symptoms include sudden changes in your mental status (confusion and hallucinations), muscles (tremors and rigidity), and nausea or diarrhea. Go to the emergency room or talk to your doctor immediately if you notice these symptoms. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist if you are unsure if your other medications will interact with Sumatriptan.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Sumatriptan works by narrowing the blood vessels. It can cause or worsen high blood pressure. If you feel dizzy or have a headache that won't go away, Sumatriptan may not be the best option for you.

description_processed.orig: Sumatriptan works by narrowing the blood vessels. It can cause or worsen high blood pressure. If you feel dizzy or have a headache that won't go away, Sumatriptan may not be the best option for you.

risks_warnings.title: Seizures
risks_warnings.description: Sumatriptan can lower the brain's threshold for seizures in people with certain risk factors. Seizures can make a person shake uncontrollably for a few seconds and zone out. Get medical help right away if you notice this.

carousel_items: Take Maxalt as soon as you feel you’re getting a headache or experience warning signs like being sensitive to light or sound.
If you're taking other medicines to control your headaches (like propranolol), the dose of Maxalt will be different.
Let your doctor know if your headaches don’t go away after taking [name-common] or if you have more than 4 migraines per month.
It’s available in two different dosage forms, a tablet you take by mouth and an orally disintegrating tablet (Maxalt-MLT) you place on your tongue to let it dissolve.
Lie down in a dark room after taking Maxalt to help ease pain. Ask your doctor about other medicines that can help prevent your headaches.

basics.benefits_moa: Maxalt is a triptan medication that treats migraine headaches. It releases serotonin, which lowers the inflammation that causes headaches.
basics.bottom_line: Maxalt is great for relieving short migraines, but doesn't work as well for long-lasting headaches.
downsides: Maxalt doesn’t prevent migraines or tension headaches, but only works once the headache starts.
It can cause rebound headaches if it’s used too often.
You need to wait at least 2 hours after your first dose to take a second dose.
May not be the best choice if you have long, drawn-out headaches. Ask your doctor about other triptans that can last longer than Maxalt.
Not a good choice if you have heart disease or if you’re pregnant or breast-feeding.

downsides_processed.orig: Maxalt doesn’t prevent migraines or tension headaches, but only works once the headache starts.

upsides: Triptans like Maxalt are considered the first-choice treatment to relieve moderate to severe migraine-type headaches.
It can also be used to treat tension-type headaches.
Not all triptans work the same way for people, so you can try multiple ones to find the right medication for you.
You don't need to drink water with the orally disintegrating tablet for it to work, so this could be a good medication for people who can't keep water down when they have a migraine.

basics.bottom_line: Diclofenac sodium works well for pain and causes less upset stomach than other NSAIDs.
downsides: Can cause serious stomach problems like inflammation, ulcers, and bleeding. The chances that a stomach problem will occur is worse the longer you take this medication, but it can happen at any time while taking it.
Like all NSAIDs, it can raise your risk of having blood clots, heart attack, or stroke.
Can lower kidney function or cause permanent kidney damage. These problems are more likely the longer you take it.

If you have high blood pressure and need a medication for the long-term treatment of pain, talk with your doctor since a different medication may be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to unborn babies

basics.benefits_moa: Depakote is an antiepileptic. Researchers don't know exactly how it works. It seems to increase the amount of GABA, a chemical that calms nerves in the brain.
basics.bottom_line: Depakote is good long-term prevention for epilepsy, bipolar disorder, and migraines, but can cause weight gain.
downsides: Can cause upset stomach, hair loss, weight gain, sleepiness, and tremor.
Can cause liver damage, so it's probably not safe if you already have liver problems.

Don't use if pregnant.

risks_warnings.title: Pregnancy
risks_warnings.description: Depakote can cause birth defects. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

description_processed.orig: Depakote can cause birth defects. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medications.

risks_warnings.title: Liver damage
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may cause liver damage, usually during the first six months of treatment. Your doctor will monitor your liver with routine blood tests. Tell your doctor immediately if you notice any weakness, fatigue, vomiting, inability to eat, or swelling in the face.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may cause liver damage, usually during the first six months of treatment. Your doctor will monitor your liver with routine blood tests. Tell your doctor immediately if you notice any weakness, fatigue, vomiting, inability to eat, or swelling in the face.

risks_warnings.title: Pancreatitis
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may cause pancreatitis (inflammation of the pancreas). This can happen at any time while taking the medication, and it can lead to hospitalization or death. Tell your doctor immediately if you notice abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, or inability to eat.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may cause pancreatitis (inflammation of the pancreas). This can happen at any time while taking the medication, and it can lead to hospitalization or death. Tell your doctor immediately if you notice abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, or inability to eat.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may cause low platelets. Platelets help your blood clot. Tell your doctor if you notice any abnormal bleeding or bruising.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may cause low platelets. Platelets help your blood clot. Tell your doctor if you notice any abnormal bleeding or bruising.

risks_warnings.title: Mental changes due to high ammonia
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may cause increased ammonia in the body. Tell your doctor if you notice any confusion, weakness, or vomiting.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may cause increased ammonia in the body. Tell your doctor if you notice any confusion, weakness, or vomiting.

risks_warnings.title: Low body temperature
risks_warnings.description: Depakote may cause low body temperature (hypothermia). Tell your doctor immediately if you notice any sudden confusion, weakness, unconsciousness, or changes in breathing.

description_processed.orig: Depakote may cause low body temperature (hypothermia). Tell your doctor immediately if you notice any sudden confusion, weakness, unconsciousness, or changes in breathing.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reactions
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Depakote can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Depakote can cause serious allergic reactions and life-threatening organ failure. Report any skin rash, fever, swelling, or trouble breathing to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal seizures
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Depakote suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Depakote, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Depakote suddenly can increase the number of seizures. If you want to stop taking Depakote, talk to your doctor before making any changes. It’s safer to slowly lower your dose of the drug over at least one week before completely stopping.

basics.benefits_moa: Propranolol is an alpha and beta blocker. It lowers blood pressure by slowing heart rate, relaxing blood vessels, and lowering the body's fight-or-flight response.
basics.bottom_line: Propranolol is good for treating many heart problems and other problems in the body, but it has more side effects than other beta blockers. You can't miss doses.
downsides: Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.
Has more side effects than some beta blockers because it crosses into the brain and central nervous system.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Propranolol suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

Also treats and prevents many non-heart problems, such as tremors, anxiety, migraines, and liver disease symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Increased chest pain or risk of heart attack
risks_warnings.description: Do not stop taking Propranolol suddenly without talking to your doctor as chest pain or angina may become increased. Stopping Propranolol suddenly may start a heart attack. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

description_processed.orig: Do not stop taking Propranolol suddenly without talking to your doctor as chest pain or angina may become increased. Stopping Propranolol suddenly may start a heart attack. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Heart failure
risks_warnings.description: Cases of heart failure due to taking Propranolol have been reported. Tell your doctor if you noticed increased swelling around your legs or ankles, sudden weight gain or sudden shortness of breath as these may be symptoms of heart failure.

description_processed.orig: Cases of heart failure due to taking Propranolol have been reported. Tell your doctor if you noticed increased swelling around your legs or ankles, sudden weight gain or sudden shortness of breath as these may be symptoms of heart failure.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risks during surgery
risks_warnings.description: If you are planning to undergo major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Propranolol, so that they can monitor your heart more closely.

description_processed.orig: If you are planning to undergo major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Propranolol, so that they can monitor your heart more closely.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of low blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Propranolol who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Propranolol.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Propranolol who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Propranolol.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of overactive thyroid
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Propranolol who also have an overactive thyroid may not recognize signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Also, do not stop taking Propranolol suddenly without consulting your doctor, as this may start a thyroid storm.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Propranolol who also have an overactive thyroid may not recognize signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Also, do not stop taking Propranolol suddenly without consulting your doctor, as this may start a thyroid storm.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: You may notice a slowing of your heart rate when you take this medication. You may experience dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls. Also tell your doctor if your heart rate goes below 55 beats per minute as they may consider changing your dose. Your doctor may monitor your heart rate and rhythm.
risk_factors: Concurrent use of non-dihydropyridine calcium channel blockers, digoxin or clonidine

This works better than any of the anti-depressants I've tried (even though they're not in the same category) and the weight loss is a nice bonus!

Taken for 3 years & have finally found the best balance of keeping my old 400mg daily dosage but split up twice a day (morning & night) to avoid the dreaded "DOPE-A-MAX" as my Doctor hilariously calls the word finding brain fog side effect.

Still get migraines but they're tolerable headaches usually and don't even require pain meds. Tingling subsided after a couple of months. Minor brain fog worth the migraine abatement. Don't mind the weight loss either.

I really took for bipolar but helps w sezuire which I had too but I stop cause it made me unstable on feet I fell few times ...had Brian fog ...I blackout few times not worth it there other treatments for both never work on the pain
Worked great for my migraines but the side effects out weighed the pros. Tingling all over, loss of appetite, I couldn't taste and anything carbonated tasted flat, and on and off brain fog.

Pros:  50 mg Topamax per day seemed to make my 3-6 migraines per month shallower, shorter, and less painful.  I also lost weight - nice!  However, I stopped taking it after a year because it was making me too tired and depressed.
Definitely reduced my appetite, but for me it's absolutely worth it for the almost perfect migraine prevention.
I take it for MS-associated nerve pain, not diabetes, but the option wasn't there. Be careful about dosage, especially if you're taking with other meds that make you sleepy.

userStories.identifier: active young professional with no kids
userStories.tip: When I started taking Topamax I was only on 50mg a day but after being on it for over a year I need to take 100mg for it to work well for me.

I take it in the evening, since it makes me sleepy - and since I have to take it daily, at the same time, I just synced it with my birth control pill. Easy-peasy.

So far it's drastically reduced my migraines. Tingly feet, though.
Topamax reduces number of full blown migraines.  Results in low energy and slower mental functions.  Till have to take nine abortives each month.

carousel_items: Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Get your blood pressure, potassium, and kidney function checked 1 week after starting the medicine, then routinely after.
Tell your doctor about any dizziness or muscle weakness that doesn't go away.
Get immediate medical help if you notice any swelling, especially around your head and neck.
Requires routine blood tests to check kidney function.
Don't take it if you're pregnant.

basics.benefits_moa: Candesartan is an angiotensin receptor blocker (ARB). By blocking a chemical that usually tightens blood vessels, it makes blood vessels relax. This lowers blood pressure and allows more blood and oxygen to get to your heart and other organs.
basics.bottom_line: Candesartan is a good blood pressure-lowering medicine that protects kidney function just like ACE inhibitors, but has fewer side effects.
downsides: Requires a yearly blood test to see how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.
Not always covered by insurance, so it can be expensive.

downsides_processed.orig: Requires a yearly blood test to see how the medicine is affecting your body.
Not safe to use if you're pregnant.
Not always covered by insurance, so it can be expensive.

upsides: Lowers the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Works similar to ACE inhibitors (like lisinopril), but doesn't have the same side effects like cough and swelling.
Protects kidney function, which is especially useful for people with diabetes or mild-to-moderate kidney disease.
Recommended for people with heart failure since it lowers the risk of death and further damage to your heart.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Candesartan can cause birth defects or death to a fetus. If you are pregnant or considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medicines.

description_processed.orig: Candesartan can cause birth defects or death to a fetus. If you are pregnant or considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about alternative medicines.

risks_warnings.title: Worsening kidney problems
risks_warnings.description: Candesartan has a risk of making your kidneys not work as well. It is important to get blood work done to check your kidney function before starting Candesartan and at least annually after.

description_processed.orig: Candesartan has a risk of making your kidneys not work as well. It is important to get blood work done to check your kidney function before starting Candesartan and at least annually after.

risks_warnings.title: Unusual tongue swelling
risks_warnings.description: Angioedema, or swelling in the face, lip, tongue, throat, or other organs, can happen at any time while you're taking Candesartan. Talk to a doctor or pharmacist if you have any head or neck swelling or abdominal pain that doesn't go away.

description_processed.orig: Angioedema, or swelling in the face, lip, tongue, throat, or other organs, can happen at any time while you're taking Candesartan. Talk to a doctor or pharmacist if you have any head or neck swelling or abdominal pain that doesn't go away.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems due to high potassium
risks_warnings.description: Candesartan can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and routine lab tests are needed to measure your potassium.

description_processed.orig: Candesartan can increase the amount of potassium in your body. High potassium can cause heart problems. Baseline and routine lab tests are needed to measure your potassium.

Can cause dizziness in the first few days.
Check your blood pressure 1 week after starting this medicine, and tell your doctor if it hasn't improved.
Can cause fatigue and insomnia.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar. Be careful if you're diabetic.
Don't stop taking this medicine suddenly.

clock.tip: Can take with or without food.

side_effects.name: Feeling cold in arms and legs

basics.benefits_moa: Atenolol is a selective beta blocker that works specifically on the heart. It lowers blood pressure by slowing down the heart and making it less work to pump.
basics.bottom_line: Atenolol is good for controlling chest pain and treating heart failure and heart attack with fewer side effects than other beta blockers. You have to take it on an empty stomach, and you can't miss doses.
downsides: You have to take Atenolol on an empty stomach.
Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Atenolol suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.

downsides_processed.orig: You have to take Atenolol on an empty stomach.
Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.

Not a first-choice treatment for high blood pressure according to the latest guidelines, except if you have heart failure or heart disease. As a second choice, your doctor might add it to medicines you're already taking if your blood pressure is still too high.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Atenolol suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.

upsides: A first-choice treatment to prevent chest pain (angina).
A first-choice treatment for heart failure and heart attack.
At lower doses, Atenolol has fewer side effects than most beta blockers because it targets the heart and doesn't cross into the brain and central nervous system.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack or increased chest pain
risks_warnings.description: Do not stop taking Atenolol suddenly without consulting your doctor if you have coronary artery disease, as chest pain or angina may become increased or it may start a heart attack. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

description_processed.orig: Do not stop taking Atenolol suddenly without consulting your doctor if you have coronary artery disease, as chest pain or angina may become increased or it may start a heart attack. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Heart failure
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people developing heart failure while taking Atenolol. If you notice swelling in your feet or ankles, or if your pulse feels fast or irregular, or shortness of breath when you lie down or during exercise, talk to your doctor.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people developing heart failure while taking Atenolol. If you notice swelling in your feet or ankles, or if your pulse feels fast or irregular, or shortness of breath when you lie down or during exercise, talk to your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Slowing of the heart rate
risks_warnings.description: You may notice a slowing of your heart rate when you take this medication, especially if you take other medications to slow your heart rate such as calcium channel blockers. You may experience dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls.

description_processed.orig: You may notice a slowing of your heart rate when you take this medication, especially if you take other medications to slow your heart rate such as calcium channel blockers. You may experience dizziness when you first take the medication. Be careful when getting up from either lying down or sitting to avoid falls.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risks during surgery
risks_warnings.description: If you are planning to undergo major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Atenolol, so that they will be aware to monitor your heart more closely.

description_processed.orig: If you are planning to undergo major surgery requiring anesthesia, tell your surgeon that you are on Atenolol, so that they will be aware to monitor your heart more closely.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of low blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Atenolol who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Atenolol.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Atenolol who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Atenolol.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of overactive thyroid
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Atenolol who also have an overactive thyroid may not recognize signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Also, do not stop taking Atenolol suddenly without talking to your doctor, as this may start a thyroid storm.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Atenolol who also have an overactive thyroid may not recognize signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Also, do not stop taking Atenolol suddenly without talking to your doctor, as this may start a thyroid storm.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of rebound high blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Do not stop taking Atenolol suddenly if you are also taking clonidine as this may cause a rebound in your blood pressure. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

description_processed.orig: Do not stop taking Atenolol suddenly if you are also taking clonidine as this may cause a rebound in your blood pressure. Talk to your doctor if you are interested in stopping this medication.

basics.benefits_moa: Bystolic is a selective beta blocker that works specifically on the heart. It lowers blood pressure by slowing down the heart and making it work less to pump.
basics.bottom_line: Bystolic is a good blood pressure-lowering medicine for people with heart conditions, and has fewer side effects than other beta blockers, but it's expensive. You can't miss doses.
downsides: Not available in less expensive generic form.
Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.
Can hide symptoms of low blood sugar if you're diabetic.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Bystolic suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.

upsides: Controls your heart rate to reduce work for your heart.
A first-line treatment for heart failure and heart attack.
Helps to lower blood pressure if you can't use first-choice treatments or need additional blood pressure control.
Many beta blockers can worsen asthma or cause headaches, but Bystolic usually doesn't because it targets the heart more specifically and causes fewer side effects.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Bystolic suddenly can cause irregular fast heartbeat, high blood pressure, poor blood circulation to your heart and increase your risk of chest pain or heart attack. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Bystolic suddenly can cause irregular fast heartbeat, high blood pressure, poor blood circulation to your heart and increase your risk of chest pain or heart attack. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

risks_warnings.title: Trouble breathing (bronchospastic disease)
risks_warnings.description: Beta-blocker medicines like Bystolic is generally not recommended for people with bronchospastic disease, like asthma, because it can trigger difficulty breathing. Bystolic has a lower chance of causing difficulty breathing, but should only be used under careful supervision of a doctor.

description_processed.orig: Beta-blocker medicines like Bystolic is generally not recommended for people with bronchospastic disease, like asthma, because it can trigger difficulty breathing. risks_warnings.title: Low blood sugar unawareness
risks_warnings.description: Use of Bystolic can hide symptoms of low blood sugar (hypoglycemia), which can be life-threatening. If you have diabetes, be aware of other signs of low blood sugar, such as hunger, irritability, headache, sweating, and confusion.

basics.benefits_moa: Verapamil is a calcium channel blocker. It lowers blood pressure by slowing your heart rate and relaxing your blood vessels. Your heart gets more oxygen and doesn't have to work as hard to pump, which can relieve chest pain.
basics.bottom_line: Verapamil works well to lower blood pressure and prevent chest pain, but you have to be okay with avoiding alcohol. You can't miss doses, and you might get persistent swelling.
downsides: Calcium channel blockers can cause swelling in your limbs. If this happens for you, it probably won't get better over time, so talk to your doctor about alternatives if it bothers you.
Women are more likely to have side effects (especially swelling) from Verapamil than men.
You can't miss doses. Stopping Verapamil suddenly can cause your blood pressure to go up suddenly, which raises the risk of heart attack and stroke.
Not a good medication for you if you drink alcohol.

basics.benefits_moa: Venlafaxine is a serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI) antidepressant. It increases serotonin and norepinephrine activity in the brain, which regulate mood.
basics.bottom_line: Venlafaxine is good for treating depression and anxiety. May work when other antidepressants haven't, it's but more likely to cause side effects and withdrawal symptoms than other antidepressants.
downsides: Can cause sexual side effects like low libido and an inability to orgasm or ejaculate.

You can take the extended-release form once a day with food either in the morning or in the evening at about the same time each day.
Extended-release capsules should be swallowed whole. If you can’t swallow pills, open the capsule, sprinkle it on a spoonful of applesauce and then swallow it without chewing.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Venlafaxine may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Venlafaxine is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Venlafaxine may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Venlafaxine is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Venlafaxine with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.

Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Venlafaxine suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1 to 2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

risks_warnings.title: High blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Venlafaxine can increase your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure regularly.

description_processed.orig: Venlafaxine can increase your blood pressure. Monitor your blood pressure regularly.

risks_warnings.title: Increased bleeding
risks_warnings.description: Venlafaxine can increase the risk of bleeding or bruising if you're also taking aspirin, NSAIDs (like ibuprofen), warfarin, or other anticoagulants. Tell your doctor about any bruising that doesn't improve, black stools, pink or red urine, or unusual bleeding (for example, from the nose or gums).

risks_warnings.title: Sexual dysfunction
risks_warnings.description: Venlafaxine can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

description_processed.orig: Venlafaxine can cause lower sex drive or difficulty having an orgasm. If the problem persists after the first 2 to 3 months, you can talk to your doctor about alternative antidepressants or performance-enhancing medications.

risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

basics.benefits_moa: Amitriptyline is a tricyclic antidepressant (TCA). Researchers don't know exactly how it works. It may change serotonin and norepinephrine activity in the brain, which regulates mood and pain perception. It also has sedative effects.
basics.bottom_line: Amitriptyline is an older antidepressant that's sometimes used to treat pain and sleep problems, but it can have more side effects than similar medications.
downsides: When used for depression, Amitriptyline causes more side effects and has a higher risk of overdose than other antidepressants. It's usually used when other medications haven't worked.
It's more likely to cause sleepiness, nausea, constipation, diarrhea, and weight gain (1 to 5 pounds) than other antidepressants.
People age 65 and older have a higher risk for this medication's side effects.

risks_warnings.title: Mania

Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

basics.benefits_moa: Enalapril is an angiotensin converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor. It blocks a chemical that tightens blood vessels. This makes blood vessels relax, which lowers blood pressure and allows more blood and oxygen to get to your heart and other organs.
basics.bottom_line: Enalapril is a good blood pressure-lowering medicine that protects kidney function.
downsides: Up to 1 in 10 people can get a dry cough with this medicine. It ranges from a mild tickle in the throat to a persistent hacking cough.

basics.benefits_moa: Keppra is an antiepileptic medication. It prevents seizures by helping regulate neurotransmitters in the brain.
basics.bottom_line: Keppra is effective for preventing seizures in people with epilepsy. Compared to other anti-seizure medications, it has few drug interactions and you don’t need to get your levels checked.
downsides: It’s important to take your dose on time so that Keppra has consistent levels in your body.
May not be the best drug to take if you have a history of psychiatric issues, such as depression or bipolar disorder.
If you have kidney problems, your dose may need to be adjusted. Your doctor will check your kidney function regularly.
Keppra is only FDA-approved to be taken with other medicines to treat epilepsy.

downsides_processed.orig: It’s important to take your dose on time so that Keppra has consistent levels in your body.

upsides: Lowers the frequency of seizures, including partial-onset, generalized tonic-clonic, and myoclonic seizures.

You won’t need to get regular blood tests to check the drug levels in your body.

basics.benefits_moa: Metoprolol tartrate is a beta blocker. It lowers blood pressure by slowing heart rate, relaxing blood vessels, and lowering the body's fight-or-flight response.
basics.bottom_line: Metoprolol tartrate is good for controlling chest pain and treating heart failure and heart attack. You have to take it with food, and you can't miss doses.
downsides: Metoprolol tartrate is the immediate release version of Toprol XL. You have to take Metoprolol tartrate with food for it to work best. (On the other hand, you can take Toprol XL any time.)
Taking a beta blocker might make you feel more tired or out of breath during exercise or normal daily routines. This gets better for most people, but for some might not go away.

risks_warnings.title: Trouble breathing (bronchospastic disease)
risks_warnings.description: Metoprolol tartrate has a beta blocker (metoprolol) that is generally not recommended for people with bronchospastic disease, like asthma, because it can trigger difficulty breathing. Metoprolol tartrate should only be used under careful supervision of a doctor.

carousel_items: Bisoprolol can make you feel dizzy the first few days you take it, so be careful driving and quickly standing up until you know how your body reacts to it.
Don't stop taking it suddenly without talking to your doctor.
If you have diabetes, Bisoprolol can make it difficult to tell if your blood sugar is low.
Can cause headache, fatigue, and make you more likely to get colds or the flu.

basics.benefits_moa: Bisoprolol is a selective beta blocker that works specifically on the heart. It lowers blood pressure by slowing down the heart and making it work less to pump.
basics.bottom_line: Bisoprolol is usually given to people who have taken  other blood pressure meds unsuccessfully or have recently had significant heart problems.
downsides: This isn't a first choice medication to lower blood pressure.
You can't stop taking it suddenly, or else you're more likely to have a heart attack or other problems with your heart.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of low blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Bisoprolol who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Bisoprolol.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Bisoprolol who are also diabetic may not recognize symptoms of low blood sugar, except for sweating and dizziness. Talk to your doctor about when to monitor your blood sugar if you are started on Bisoprolol.

risks_warnings.title: Masked symptoms of overactive thyroid
risks_warnings.description: Patients on Bisoprolol who also have overactive thyroid may not recognize the signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Don't stop taking Bisoprolol suddenly without talking to your doctor, since this can cause worse thyroid problems.

description_processed.orig: Patients on Bisoprolol who also have overactive thyroid may not recognize the signs of hyperthyroidism, such as fast heart rate. Don't stop taking Bisoprolol suddenly without talking to your doctor, since this can cause worse thyroid problems.

risks_warnings.title: Heart attack
risks_warnings.description: Don't stop taking Bisoprolol suddenly without talking to your doctor if you have coronary artery disease, since chest pain (angina) can increase suddenly or trigger a heart attack.

description_processed.orig: Don't stop taking Bisoprolol suddenly without talking to your doctor if you have coronary artery disease, since chest pain (angina) can increase suddenly or trigger a heart attack.

risks_warnings.title: Increased symptoms of heart failure
risks_warnings.description: Worsening symptoms of heart failure, such as increased swelling in your arms and legs, can occur if your doctor decides to increase your dosage of Bisoprolol. Your doctor can work with you to minimize these effects.
